body: LGTM :+1: ! @thammegowda @sebastian-nagel @lewismc
hi @merito any reason this was closed?
I need to investigate it better. I hope I'll reopen it this week with working code.
got it thanks @merito
+1, looks great to me!
+1 @lewismc I'll see about throwing an example in there when I commit.
Note, closing this manually since I buggered the merge =D

@thammegowda can you update the PR and bring it up to date with master - since there are conflicts that must be resolved. @sebastian-nagel I am going to commit this evening PT Los Angeles time if there are no further comments and/or objections. Thamme was worked to address many/most of the comments and we are hoping you will agree.
@chrismattmann I am on it.
@chrismattmann Done!
thanks will commit this morning @thammegowda
@sebastian-nagel you keen to rebase and commit? I am working on an overhaul of the entire MR API upgrading everyting to MRv2 so I don't want to screw your patch up.
Yep, will rebase, resolve conflicts and commit. Looks like I have to commit via git.
Sorry, @thammegowda, I didn't manage to test the plugin. Looks good, afaics. Please, commit, @chrismattmann.

@thammegowda there are now conflicts again (mostly having to do with the fact that Nutch now uses git and trunk was renamed to master). Can you update one more time. Thanks @sebastian-nagel for your +1 I'll commit once @thammegowda updates.
Nice patch. Do you have any test cases in mind?
ping @thammegowda

Thank you a lot for your help. 

I didn't know that this enhancement of theses logs can improve the performance more than 30 times. It's impressive. :)
If you want test it, you have to give theses properties to nutch-site.xml : 

```
<property>
  <name>http.content.limit</name>
  <value>-1</value>
</property>

<property>
  <name>tika.boilerpipe</name>
  <value>true</value>
</property>

<property>
  <name>plugin.includes</name>
 <value>protocol-http|urlfilter-regex|parse-(tika)|index-(basic|anchor)|urlnormalizer-(pass|regex|basic)|scoring-opic</value>
</property>
```

After a recompile you can try and compare with or without tika.boilerpipe : 

> ./nutch indexchecker URL
@jeremie70 can you please update this PR? I'll go ahead and get it committed or @lewismc can
I did it. I forgot something ?
i think you did forget something since I don't see any changes from you here on this PR since @lewismc comments. Did you make sure to push to your remote so this PR gets updated?

I'm a new user that is possible that i missed something. 
But i pushed a new commit with descriptions in nutch-default.xml, i modified the system of log and i added a property in the indexchecker to see all the field. It's appear in the "files changed" so i think that i updated the patch. Can you check again @chrismattmann  please ? Check if you see a new description commited in this part of the code : 

```
<property>
  <name>tika.boilerpipe</name>
  <value>false</value>
  <description>Define if the parser tika uses boilerpipe or not. This property needs to activate the parse-tika in the plugin.includes property.
  </description>
 </property>
```

@jeremie70 no nothing has been updated. Can you please push your branch (say your branch was origin), something like

```
git push origin my-branch
```

Thanks

I found the problem, i pushed with the bad email, so github didn't show to other my commit. 
I will resolve this tomorow.
Thank you for your help. ;)
It would be good now. :)

@ptorrestr this is a nice patch. I am slightly concerned about the overlap between the two elastic plugin. I would be happy for your plugin here to replace the existing plugin. What do you think? Thanks for the contribution.

@lewismc I updated the files. 

Unfortunately, ES 1.X and 2.X are not compatible.
I tested using ES 1.7 and I found an error similar as mentioned [here](https://discuss.elastic.co/t/elasticsearch-2-0-java-client/35301). 

I don't know which one is more popular right now. I think will be good keep both for a while until ES 2.X become more popular.
@ptorrestr Have you tested this with Nutch 1.x or will it only work in 2.x?
@valencik I only tried Nutch 2.x
thanks @jeremie70 i will review cc @lewismc
@ptorrestr @lewismc what's the solution here. Should we merge to 2.x?
merged thanks @jeremie70
@lewismc what's the status of this patch? are we close to merging?
In which Nutch 2.x version it will land?
@dastergon the very next release which is currently slated for 2.4
@lewismc is there any ETA for that version?

If you can please help me with https://github.com/apache/nutch/pull/99 it would be greatly appreciated.
This is the only blocker.
@lewismc ok, I will try to reproduce it
The formatting on this entire patch is incorrect. The Nutch codebase uses two space indents for code formatting. Can you please push an updated pull request for the entire patch? Thanks @karanjeets
Sorry, I might have missed that. I will correct it and update the PR. Thanks @lewismc

I don't know if you use Eclipse, if you do then there is a template here
https://github.com/apache/nutch/blob/master/eclipse-codeformat.xml
thanks for the review @lewismc
ping @lewismc any status on this?

I think I will fire a PR up today.

On Sun, Mar 27, 2016 at 11:56 AM, Chris Mattmann notifications@github.com
wrote:

> ping @lewismc https://github.com/lewismc any status on this?
>

> https://github.com/apache/nutch/pull/95#issuecomment-202125658

## 

_Lewis_

@lewismc - yes, you got me there. :) I use Eclipse only. 
Thanks, I will use the template for this and future development. This should make my life easy.
@karanjeets did you update?
@chrismattmann @lewismc Updated the PR.
@lewismc - Done. Updated the PR. Please check.

Description:
1) The user should enable the plugin by enabling scoring-similarity in the plugin.includes property in nutch-site.xml.
2) Copy the gold-standard file into the conf directory and enter the name of this file in nutch-site.xml.
3) The user should include the following property in nutch-site.xml to specify the window size for ngram model:
`<property>`
    `<name>scoring.similarity.ngrams</name>`
    `<description>Specifies the 'n' in ngrams</description>`
`</property>`
4) If the user does not include the above mentioned property, the default size will be 1, i.e unigrams will be considered for similarity scoring.

Use Case: 
It is extremely useful in cases where the user specifies names entities in the gold standard. For example "Leonardo DiCaprio"  is one of the terms in gold standard. The ngram model with a window size 2, will provide distinction between pages pertaining to "Leonardo da Vinci", which otherwise would not be captured. Another example is where user is looking for phrases/dialogues, the window size can be cleverly adjusted depending on the content of the gold standard.
@lewismc Can you please review and confirm if any changes are required.
@andreybratus yes

changes r good I will merge
In the future please create an issue with title which is exact as the corresponding Jira issue.
You are ALWAYS credited in Jira for registering an issue and acting on it. If you wish you can draw aggregations based on this.
Thank you Sir.
Overall, the patch it looking excellent.
Thanks @lewismc . Sure, I will take care of the issue title in future. :)

I have tried out the patch, works as expected, going to commit now. 
Thanks @bhavyasanghavi!
Anyone able to have a look at this patch? I am tempted to merge and then work on another patch which uses a persistent datastore to verify if (and why) data is being lost.
I am going to create a separate test which utilizes a persistent Datastore... it turns out that this is required now.

Hi @naegelejd this is a cool patch. There is unfortunately a pretty serious issue. Unfortunately, we cannot release this plugin within Apache software. Please see http://www.apache.org/licenses/GPL-compatibility.html, the thirst party CSS parser code is LGPL licensed... which is a real shame.
@naegelejd maybe you could use https://github.com/corgrath/osbcp-css-parser???

Thanks @lewismc, I admit I actually didn't check the license of the third-party CSS parser library. It's unfortunate that this is an issue at all, especially since Nutch plugins are just that: optional plugins. I don't think I want to switch to the other library you mentioned as the LGPL licensed one is better maintained and implements the [SAC](https://www.w3.org/Style/CSS/SAC/Overview.en.html).

 I noticed you brought up a plugin central discussion on nutch-dev. Perhaps this plugin would be better hosted on Maven Central, available to Nutch at build-time. Let me know if I can help push that forward.

A agree with everything your saying. I think we need to address this plugin issue and host everything on Maven central. Lets keep this issue open for the time being. The plugin looks grand. I am going to propose a couple of suggestions so feel free to take them on board if you have time.
I think we should retire the ES 1.X plugin (comment it out in build.xml) and then have this as the default plugin. I will do some core review later today.

@ptorrestr can you please address the logging issues? Can you also please comment out the existing entries in [build.xml](https://github.com/apache/nutch/blob/2.x/src/plugin/build.xml) so that these plugins do not clash. That would be great.
Of course, and no problem, I can make changes as you suggest them.
@lewismc done. Should I change the name to "elastic"?

No, i think that elastic 2 is good. If someone wishes to use elastic1 then they still can. Thanks I will merge ASAP.
Thanks
Nice patch. I tried it out with some test segment and have reviewed the code. +1 from me. I'll commit shortly unless objections.
+1 looks good to me. commit! :)
Hey @chrismattmann  can you please tag Harsha here? I can't seem to find him to alert him to this quick fix ..
@lewismc why don't we pull this into a branch? Then we can commit and update there.
@lewismc happy to review anything here later tonight if you have it. Cheers aye
@karanjeets can you resolve the conflicts here and then update your branch? I'd be happy to push ASAP.
i fixed the conflicts, merged!

And if you want i can test your patch for the master branch @lewismc. I had some problems of library version in my last try if i remember good.

@jeremie70  the problems with the library version made us release the nutch code as well in the rep, as this was one of the only versions we (or in particular petar) got it working without any library conflicts.

There are issues with Any23 which I've been working on. They are blocking
issues. Head over to Any23 to find out about them if any of you are
interested.
Lewis

@chrismattmann did you check the license of the plugin code? Unfortunately as mentioned above it is  LGPL licensed. It is fine to have it in the repos, but not OK for us to release the plugin with our shipped releases.

crud @lewismc good catch. we should probably at a minimum back this out. I see based on http://cssparser.sourceforge.net/license.html that the license won't work. Sigh. Please feel free to revert. Just trying to push everything forward and missed the license part.

@chrismattmann yeah I was sad about this one as well. I've uploaded the patch (thank you @naegelejd) to the relevant Jira issue for future use and have also reverted the commit. Thanks again @naegelejd for the patch it would have been great to get in to master but we cannot ship the code.
Of course. I'll keep this in the back of my mind in case I come up with an alternative solution. Thanks guys!
great work @kamaci ! nice!
